{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06238v1", "title": "Infinite Boundary Friction Limit for Weak Solutions of the Stochastic
  Navier-Stokes Equations", "summary": "We address convergence of the unique weak solutions of the 2D stochastic
Navier-Stokes equations with Navier boundary conditions, as the boundary
friction is taken uniformly to infinity, to the unique weak solution under the
no-slip condition. Our result is that for initial velocity in $L^2_x$, the
convergence holds in probability in $C_tW^{-\varepsilon,2}_x \cap L^2_tL^2_x$
for any $0 < \varepsilon$. The noise is of transport-stretching type, although
the theorem holds with other transport, multiplicative and additive noise
structures. This seems to be the first work concerning the large boundary
friction limit with noise, and convergence for weak solutions, due to only
$L^2_{x}$ initial data, appears new even deterministically.", "main_category": "math.PR", "categories": "math.PR,math.AP", "published": "2025-04-08T17:34:29Z"}
